EmailTemplate.subject: Sorry we missed you – remember to say YES to NCS
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hello {!Contact.Name} and Parent/ Guardian,
We recently tried to contact you about a fantastic opportunity with NCS (National Citizen Service) with The Challenge that {!Contact.FirstName} expressed an interest in.
What is NCS with The Challenge? The NCS with The Challenge autumn programme is a part-residential youth programme for 16- 17 year olds . It reaches beyond school or college to help young people to get ahead in work and life. It's the perfect opportunity to develop skills which look great on a CV or UCAS application – and to make friends and have fun along the way! It runs over October half-term (25-31 October) and four weekend days in November. The programme structure is:
Part 1 - residential (4 days, 3 nights): 25 – 28 October Part 2 – non-residential (3 days): 29 – 31 October Part 3 – non-residential weekend days (4 separate days): Saturday 8 November, Sunday 9 November, Saturday 15 November, Saturday 22 November.
How do I apply? It's easy to sign up online, and online applications receive a £5 discount. Parents/guardians should follow this link and use {!Contact.FirstName}’s unique login details to start their application:
ID Number: {!Contact.Account_s_TCN_Id__c} Password: {!Contact.Login_PIN__c}
How much does it cost? Each place is valued at over £1000 but government backing means the maximum cost you'll pay is a £50 administration fee. Accommodation, food, transport and equipment used during the programme is all covered. If you need some help with this cost you can request financial support when signing up.
- Participants must meet our age eligibility requirements – generally, they need to have turned 16 or 17 on or before 31 August 2014 and must not be 18 during the residential part of the programme. - The first two parts of the programme run from Saturday 25 October – Friday 31 October, which will be half-term for the majority of schools in the areas we operate in.
More questions? Take a look at our Questions page, or get in touch at contact@the-challenge.org or on 0203 542 2400.
Places are limited so apply soon - don’t miss out on this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!
Yours sincerely,
Rebecca Carter - Director at The Challenge
